intro: Aeschynanthus stenocalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leaved waxflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant produces its flowers in clusters, often during the rainy season, and has thick, fleshy leaves adapted to arid conditions. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family, which includes many ornamental plants. Aeschynanthus stenocalyx is often cultivated for its attractive blooms and is relatively easy to care for in suitable growing conditions.
